metadata.author: Microsoft - support@microsoft.com
metadata.comments: Solution template for Pulse Connect Secure

metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup

properties.description: Pulse Connect Secure data connector with template version 3.0.2

connectorUiConfig.title: [Deprecated] Pulse Connect Secure
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The [Pulse Connect Secure](https://www.pulsesecure.net/products/pulse-connect-secure/) connector allows you to easily connect your Pulse Connect Secure logs with Microsoft Sentinel, to view dashboards, create custom alerts, and improve investigations. Integrating Pulse Connect Secure with Microsoft Sentinel provides more insight into your organization's network and improves your security operation capabilities.
connectorUiConfig.additionalRequirementBanner: These queries are dependent on a parser based on a Kusto Function deployed as part of the solution.

sampleQueries.query:
PulseConnectSecure 
 | where vpn_message startswith 'Login failed'
 | summarize count() by vpn_user 
 | top 10 by count_

sampleQueries.description: Top 10 Failed Logins by IP Address
sampleQueries.query:
PulseConnectSecure 
 | where vpn_message startswith 'Login failed'
 | summarize count() by client_ip 
 | top 10 by count_

dataTypes.name: Syslog (PulseConnectSecure)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
PulseConnectSecure
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
PulseConnectSecure
            | where TimeGenerated > ago(3d)
    |take 1
        | project IsConnected = true

customs.name: Pulse Connect Secure
customs.description: must be configured to export logs via Syslog

instructionSteps.description: >**NOTE:** This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected which is deployed as part of the solution. To view the function code in Log Analytics, open Log Analytics/Microsoft Sentinel Logs blade, click Functions and search for the alias Pulse Connect Secure and load the function code or click [here](https://aka.ms/sentinel-PulseConnectSecure-parser), on the second line of the query, enter the hostname(s) of your Pulse Connect Secure device(s) and any other unique identifiers for the logstream. The function usually takes 10-15 minutes to activate after solution installation/update.

Typically, you should install the agent on a different computer from the one on which the logs are generated.

>  Syslog logs are collected only from **Linux** agents.

parameters.title: Choose where to install the agent:

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Linux Virtual Machine
instructionSteps.description: Select the machine to install the agent on and then click **Connect**.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Linux Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.

instructionSteps.title: 1. Install and onboard the agent for Linux

instructionSteps.description:
Configure the facilities you want to collect and their severities.
 1. Under workspace advanced settings **Configuration**, select **Data** and then **Syslog**.
 2. Select **Apply below configuration to my machines** and select the facilities and severities.
 3.  Click **Save**.
instructionSteps.title: 2. Configure the logs to be collected

instructionSteps.description: [Follow the instructions](https://help.ivanti.com/ps/help/en_US/PPS/9.1R13/ag/configuring_an_external_syslog_server.htm) to enable syslog streaming of Pulse Connect Secure logs. Use the IP address or hostname for the Linux device with the Linux agent installed as the Destination IP address.
instructionSteps.title: 3. Configure and connect the Pulse Connect Secure

properties.description: PulseConnectSecure Data Parser with template version 3.0.2

metadata.description:
Gain insight into Pulse Secure VPN by analyzing, collecting and correlating vulnerability data.
This workbook provides visibility into user VPN activities

properties.description:
@{workbookKey=PulseConnectSecureWorkbook; logoFileName=Azure_Sentinel.svg; description=Gain insight into Pulse Secure VPN by analyzing, collecting and correlating vulnerability data.
This workbook provides visibility into user VPN activities; dataTypesDependencies=System.Object[]; dataConnectorsDependencies=System.Object[]; previewImagesFileNames=System.Object[]; version=1.0.0; title=Pulse Connect Secure; templateRelativePath=PulseConnectSecure.json; subtitle=; provider=Pulse Secure}.description
This query identifies evidence of potential brute force attack by looking at multiple failed attempts to log into the VPN server
properties.query:
let threshold = 20;
PulseConnectSecure
| where Messages contains "Login failed"
| summarize StartTime = min(TimeGenerated), EndTime = max(TimeGenerated), count() by User, Source_IP
| where count_ > threshold
| extend timestamp = StartTime, AccountCustomEntity = User, IPCustomEntity = Source_IP

properties.description: This query identifies evidence of failed login attempts from a large number of distinct users on a Pulse Connect Secure VPN server
properties.displayName: PulseConnectSecure - Large Number of Distinct Failed User Logins
properties.query:
let threshold = 100;
PulseConnectSecure
| where Messages startswith "Login failed"
| summarize dcount(User) by Computer, bin(TimeGenerated, 15m)
| where dcount_User > threshold
| extend timestamp = TimeGenerated, HostCustomEntity = Computer

properties.displayName: PulseConnectSecure - Large Number of Distinct Failed User Logins

properties.descriptionHtml:
Note: Please refer to the following before installing the solution:

• Review the solution Release Notes

• There may be known issues pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing.

The Pulse Connect Secure solution for Microsoft Sentinel enables you to ingest Pulse Connect Secure logs into Microsoft Sentinel.

This solution is dependent on the Syslog solution containing the Syslog via AMA connector to collect the logs. The Syslog solution will be installed as part of this solution installation.

NOTE: Microsoft recommends installation of Syslog via AMA Connector. Legacy connector uses the Log Analytics agent which is about to be deprecated by Aug 31, 2024. Using MMA and AMA on same machine can cause log duplication and extra ingestion cost more details.

Data Connectors: 1, Parsers: 1, Workbooks: 1, Analytic Rules: 2

Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel | Learn more about Solutions
